p: Both viral infections share similar disease manifestations including fever, rash and other non-specific findings. CHIKV presents after an incubation period of 2–3 days, as an abrupt onset of febrile illness with arthralgia and rash that resolves spontaneously in 7–10 days. However, in some patients, disease may progress to recurrent, debilitating polyarthralgia and poly-arthritis lasting for months to years [ 2]. Additionally, some patients may present with signs of central nervous system involvement, making it essential to diagnose.
